metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5223 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in PHPMailer before 5.2.22. PHPMailer's msgHTMLmethod applies transformations to an HTML document to make it usable as anemail message body. One of the transformations is to convert relative imageURLs into attachments using a script-provided base directory. If no basedirectory is provided, it resolves to /, meaning that relative image URLsget treated as absolute local file paths and added as attachments. To forma remote vulnerability, the msgHTML method must be called, passed anunfiltered, user-supplied HTML document, and must not set a base directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5223` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libphp-phpmailer - 5.2.14+dfsg-2.3+deb9u1build0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libphp-phpmailer package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.14+dfsg-2.3+deb9u1build0.18.04.1').
